snippet: Eight countries’ diplomats are refocusing on talks between Afghanistan and the Taliban before NATO troops leave, but sharply different visions for peace have hindered the effort.
abstract: Eight countries' diplomats are refocusing on talks between Afghan government and its Taliban foes in effort to negotiate peace deal; energized reach for peace has so far achieved growing consensus that regional stability demands political settlement with Taliban, after  war costing  tens of thousands of Afghan and Western lives and nearly a trillion dollars failed to put down the insurgency.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and DECLAN WALSH

lead_paragraph: Eight countries’ diplomats are refocusing on talks between Afghanistan and the Taliban before NATO troops leave, but sharply different visions for peace have hindered the effort.

headline.seo: Pressure for Peace With Taliban Is Renewed
headline.main: Renewed Push for Afghans to Make Peace With Taliban
headline.print_headline: Little Hope Amid Push For Afghans On Peace
